bow: side effects of having child did anyone else find their mojo completely gone after having their child just nothing is there it making my husband self conscious but try to explain it me no tingle no urge nothing feel so bad yup totally hoping it comes back once stop breastfeeding throw hubby bone every couple weeks or so but honestly could do without it have zero interest feel really bad but luckily my husband is understanding or if it really bothers him he does show it yes absolutely happened to me as well was not prepared had no idea that this was thing that happens and it actually seems quite common it would ve been helpful if known about it ahead of time but no one talks about that part of motherhood men especially need to be made aware ahead of time as well sadly the disappearance of my sex drive although only temporary was the beginning of the end of my marriage he just couldn accept the changes that came with me becoming mother and convinced himself it would always be that way people need to talk about this more because it can really throw wrench in your relationship if you aren prepared it extremely comforting to know not alone here thought there was something wrong with me for feeling that way stay at home with toddler and an infant by the end of the day so tired of being touched and needed that all want to do is sit by myself got mine back around the time my child turned uhm yup not even going to tell you how long it been gone ok fine my kid is almost three it like ve become asexual since having her 🤷🏼‍♀️ yeah between the hormones and the exhaustion and the post baby body changes it hard it did come back for me especially once started getting more opportunities to recharge and have few bits of personal time so don despair tonight we tried mood stimulate it called cloud9 not advertising but had about an hour of urge so it worked be it all natural think it just pride issue just hate that it has come to this you never hear about it with all the changes you re going to go through asking the woman at hustler was so embarrassing but just want to make him happy mine came back eventually too maybe around year to year and half personally get so mentally amp emotionally exhausted taking care of our kid all day that need lot of schmoozing kind words gentle affection little acts of kindness to be anywhere close to in the mood told my hubs this when explaining that have pretty much no interest in sex anymore and we still do it every week or two but he doesn go through all the effort to make it worth my while some people advocate having sex regularly just so you keep it together and it kinda works well that way even when you aren 100 into it as long as it feels nice it can be enjoyable to physically connect with your partner and sometimes you end up having an orgasm without ton of work this is absolutely normal for new mothers please do beat yourself up about it definitely would encourage you and your husband to learn more about your hormones and how they will continue to change postpartum please know that this is forever and with some patience and grace from both of you your mojo will come back idk how far postpartum you are but mine returned around maybe or months returned but not quite to normal and think that still considered pretty quick having baby adding another child changes not only your body but your life in drastic ways the adjustments that come with that take time breastfeeding in particular can make it hard know that for me big part of what helped it return was that had recovered from most of the physical parts of having child and had finally found my groove as mother was more confident had routine was able to find little time for myself and once had some time for myself it was easier to prioritize making time for us too now this is all saying it did take time and we did still have intimate time occasionally when my mojo had returned quite yet but that was because it was still my marriage and had to at least try we would always stop if felt uncomfortable obviously but he would often feel better with even just little bit of touch attention cuddles intimacy and just knowing that cared enough to try please give yourself plenty of time help your husband and yourself learn more about why you may be feeling this way it does mean you are attracted to him anymore it just how your body works right now and it will continue to change as well remind yourself that even though intimacy is very important in marriage so is communication and that not all intimacy has to be sexual do force yourself to do anything you do want to to make him feel better but remember that while you may feel touched out be may feel ignored and undeserving of your touch since it all goes to baby now anyway this has turned into rambling but this is forever be patient with yourself and your husband during this time you ll both find your groove eventually and congratulations wow im glad
